Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact that President Trump has had on job creation, particularly by taking credit for job gains that occurred before his inauguration.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the auto industry will be put back to work.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the decline in auto manufacturing jobs can be solely attributed to factors that President Trump can control, without considering other economic factors.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the ongoing trend of job growth in the auto manufacturing industry since the Great Recession, suggesting that there may be alternative explanations for the industry's performance.
